ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Hello, new bard (level 3) and well met to all!
ygData.messageBody:
What does /pet taunt do?

-Talien

On Mon, 9 Apr 2001, John Grady wrote:

> One comment on your macro Matt. Since VI is changing assist back again,
> the seperate /pet attack command isn't needed right? How about
> substituting /pet taunt to try to reduce the damage to your party.
>
> Tzeetch
>
> --- Matt DeBarger <mattdeba@...> wrote:
>
> <HR>
> <html><body>
> <tt>
> Charming in a group is the best thing to do on a 2 pull even if there is
> a<BR>
> chanter.  Once you get good, the mob will be doing 90% of its damage
> on the<BR>
> party's main target, 10% on you.  Thats a great tradeoff to 0-10%
> damage<BR>
> done to chanter/healer and mana spent mezzing.<BR>
> <BR>
> Here is my "pet assist" hotkey, it works great.  Rule 1,
> let the group know<BR>
> what you're doing, and make sure its ok with the enchanter.  Most are
> happy<BR>
> for the mana you save them.  Type A enchanters will not be happy, so
> then<BR>
> just let them mez the mob...<BR>
> <BR>
> Ok 2 Pull comes, assist the puller and find out what mob he is
> killing.<BR>
> Target the non targeted mob and hit charm, once it sticks (very low
> resists<BR>
> if you have a good CHA) hit the "pet assist" hotkey.<BR>
> <BR>
> Once you get this down its easy to weave 2 other songs while doing
> this...<BR>
> <BR>
> "Pet Assist"<BR>
> /pet back off<BR>
> /assist <main assist name><BR>
> /pause 3<BR>
> /pet attack<BR>
> <BR>
> The pet back off is not necesaary, but seems to help.  Sometimes
> charms mobs<BR>
> will still attack other party members or pets, the pet back off will
> prevent<BR>
> this.  It also lets the party know what you have charmed, since your
> pet<BR>
> will say something.  THe down side is the second or so of melee you
> lose<BR>
> from your pet while he is waiting for the attack command.<BR>
> <BR>
> As a side not, /pet back off, is probably the best mem blur spell in
> the<BR>
> game.<BR>
> <BR>
> </tt>
>
> <br>
>
